Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Sokar
Description: This plastered and painted wooden statue, once part of the É. de Meester de Ravestein collection, probably decorated a coffin or canopic chest. It depicts Sokar, the patron god of the Memphite necropolis. He is shown as a falcon and usually wore a crown with sun disk and two feathers on top of ram's horns. The bird of prey's wings are painted red and are decorated with a net pattern.
